title: Practice as speech pathologist or audiologist; title or description of services
context: ยง468E-3 Practice as speech pathologist or audiologist; title or description of services. (a) A person represents oneself to be a speech pathologist when the person: (1) Holds oneself out to the public by any title or description of services incorporating the words &ldquo;speech pathologist&rdquo;, &ldquo;speech pathology&rdquo;, &ldquo;speech therapy&rdquo;, &ldquo;speech correction&rdquo;, &ldquo;speech correctionist&rdquo;, &ldquo;speech therapist&rdquo;, &ldquo;speech clinic&rdquo;, &ldquo;speech clinician&rdquo;, &ldquo;language pathologist&rdquo;, &ldquo;language pathology&rdquo;, &ldquo;logopedics&rdquo;, &ldquo;logopedist&rdquo;, &ldquo;communicology&rdquo;, &ldquo;communicologist&rdquo;, &ldquo;asphasiologist&rdquo;, &ldquo;voice therapy&rdquo;, &ldquo;voice therapist&rdquo;, &ldquo;voice pathology&rdquo;, or &ldquo;voice pathologist&rdquo;, &ldquo;language therapist&rdquo;, or &ldquo;phoniatrist&rdquo;, or any similar titles; (2) Purports to treat stuttering, stammering, or other disorders of speech; (3) Is employed as a faculty member in speech pathology; (4) Is employed as a speech pathologist by the State or any county agency. (b) A person represents oneself to be an audiologist when the person: (1) Holds oneself out to the public by any title or description of services incorporating the terms &ldquo;audiology&rdquo;, &ldquo;audiologist&rdquo;, &ldquo;audiological&rdquo;, &ldquo;hearing clinic&rdquo;, &ldquo;hearing clinician&rdquo;, &ldquo;hearing therapist&rdquo;, or any similar titles; (2) Is employed as a faculty member in audiology; (3) Is employed as an audiologist by the State or any county agency. [L 1974, c 48, pt of ยง1; am L 1981, c 242, ยง3; gen ch 1985]
